page.title: 05Marley Hill
page.content: A small former mining village. There are lO terraces of brick houses, 8 aged miners cottages, some larger detached houses, a church (C of E), a large community centre and a primary school. There are two allotment plots nearby. Some working, as well as retired miners still live in Marley Hill. In the past men worked at local coke ovens or on the colliery line, now gone. One thing has remained, the Miners Welfare Institute, opened by the Dule of York in l936. It still performs many of its old uses, providing football, bowling, snooker and dances. Badminton and a folk moot are new but cricket has gone. Discos are held for the younger ones. The institute is still the village's meeting place but is now Council owned.
